div.span: US-IN-Indianapolis, US-Texas-San Antonio, US-Illinois-Chicago, US-GA-Atlanta, US-North Carolina-Charlotte, US-OH-Cincinnati, US-Louisiana-Metairie, US-Massachusetts-Boston, US-Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh, US-FL-Tampa, US-New Hampshire-Portsmouth, US-South Carolina-Lancaster

div.font: Clinical Risk Investigator
Clinical Compliance
National, WAH

Humana’s dream is to help our members and our own associates achieve lifelong well-being. Use your clinical experience to work with patients and providers in a nontraditional environment where your knowledge will make a difference. Our associates know their work is vitally important; we strive to ensure we provide perfect service with one-on-one member interactions as a coach, personal nurse, or clinical advisor. Humana’s Perfect Service® means getting the basics done right, delivering value and quality, providing guidance on needs, and being engaged with our members. We want to help our members make the right choices to live life fully. We begin that process by connecting our members with an associate who cares.

Clinical Compliance is looking for a Clinical Risk Investigator to conduct investigations on complaints that may involve fraud, abuse, theft, and/or exploitation, and perform various other duties pertaining to complaints, inquires, and occurrences that come into our team. In this role you will:
Utilize multiple computer applications to extract and compare data
Conduct satisfaction calls to members to determine quality issues
Compile data and create a report to submit findings to committee
Report adverse decisions to the relevant Board of Nursing

Perform other duties within the team, such as guiding associates in proper way to respond to a member’s inquiry or complaint, following up on incidents reported to our team, identifying trends, responding to emails coming into the team mailbox.
Other duties as assigned
Bachelors Degree
Minimum of two years investigative experience
Ability to understand investigative processes
Strong organizational skills
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Strong customer service skills
Strong experience with (MS Word, Excel)
Must be detail oriented and strong observation to details
Strong personal and professional ethics
Must have a separate room with a locked door that can be used as a home office to ensure absolute and continuous privacy while you work.

Must have accessibility to high speed DSL or cable modem for a home office (Satellite internet service is NOT allowed for this role); and recommended speed for optimal performance from Humana systems is 10M x 1M
Prior healthcare experience
Ability to filter and manipulating data in Excel
Microsoft Access experience

li.font: Strong background in writing concisely and accurately
Experience working in a health plan
Understanding of healthcare industry, investigative processes, and auditing a plus

div.font: You will be reporting to a Manager within the Healthcare Services Compliance & Risk Management Organization.

At Humana, we know your well-being is important to you, and it’s important to us too. That’s why we’re committed to making resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life. If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana.

div.span: At Humana, we know your well-being is important to you, and it’s important to us too. That’s why we’re committed to making resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life. If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana. After applying, we encourage you to join our Talent Network as well, so you can stay informed and up to date on what’s happening around our organization in the changing world of healthcare.
